servinfo.title: Motor not running – No operating sound of magnetic switch
servinfo.ptxt: Possible symptoms due to starting system trouble would be as follows:

item.ptxt: Starting motor does not run (or runs slowly)
Starting motor runs but fails to crank engine

servinfo.ptxt: Proper diagnosis must be made to determine exactly where the cause of each trouble lies in battery, wiring harness, (including starting motor switch), starting motor or engine.
Do not remove motor just because starting motor does not run. Check the following items and narrow down scope of possible causes.

s1.ptxt: Tightness of battery terminals (including ground cable connection on engine side) and starting motor terminals

condition.ptxt: Motor not running – No operating sound of magnetic switch

ps.ptxt: Transmission range sensor is not in P or N, or not adjusted (A/T)

action.ptxt: Shift in P or N, or adjust sensor.

ps.ptxt: Malfunction of clutch pedal position switch (M/T)
Battery voltage too low due to battery deterioration
Poor contact in battery terminal connection
Fuse set loose or blown off
Poor contacting action of ignition switch and magnetic switch
Lead wire coupler loose in place
Open-circuit between ignition switch and magnetic switch
Brushes are seating poorly or worn down
Poor sliding or plunger and/or pinion

action.ptxt: “Main Relay, Fuel Pump Relay, Starting Motor Control Relay and Throttle Actuator Control Relay Inspection: in Section 1C”.
“Inspection of ECM and its Circuits: in Section 1A”.
